problem: What is the smallest three-digit positive integer congruent to 1 (mod 7)?
solution: We divide 100 by 7 to obtain a quotient of 14 and a remainder 2. Since 100 is congruent to 2 (mod 7), we find that 99 is congruent to 1 (mod 7). Thus the next integer congruent to 1 (mod 7) is $99 + 7 = \boxed{106}$.
